p: Approval for nasopharyngeal swab sample collection was provided by Istanbul University, Faculty of Medicine, Clinical Research Ethics Committee. Patients with influenza-like symptoms were selected for the study. Nasopharyngeal samples were collected using Virocult swabs (Medical Wire Equipment Co., Corsham, United Kingdom). The swab samples were added to 1 ml liquid medium, mixed thoroughly with a vortex mixer, and stored at 4Â°C until use for rRT-PCR.
